column4: hey everyone. I just downloaded an update from update manager this morning for adobe flash 64 plugin, and now I am having problems with flash player.
downloaded from where?
ubuntu update manager
using firefox?
yes firefox
linuxuz3r go into firefox  tools tab and addons and search for "flash aid" install it and then run the wizard it will fix your problems
I just tried that and still no fix. It actually froze now when I tried a youtube video
did you run the wizard ?
yes. I am running stable flash version to see if that helps
I tried wizard like it said but just froze
you may need to kill everything else ... then run the wizard
ok I ran quick mode and selected install stable flash and now it works :)
that is the only work around i have found as of right now for flash on a X64 system
so it did help :)
yea it works. thank you sir :)
no problem glad i could help :)
I think it downgraded it but atleast it works now
they are working on a stable version for the X64
ya I guess i better wait before I try installing it from the update manager
i'm just going to wait till "flash aid" says it's stable lol
good idea lol
a thought.... you may want to go back to the package manager... uninstall that one and then run flash aid again to see if it can install the X64
I see here in the package manager that I have flashplugin-installer checked and there is a flashplugin64-install at version 11.0.1.98 not installed
you may want to give that a try then.... most it will do is mess up and you uninstall it
